intro: Adesmia macrostachya, commonly known as the broad-stalked burro's tail, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are followed by bean-like pods. Its leaves are opposite and pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Adesmia macrostachya is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions.
